required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Reader Study to Assess Accuracy and Reliability of Flortaucipir F 18 PET Scan Interpretation
clinical_study.official_title: A Reader Study to Assess Accuracy and Reliability of Flortaucipir F 18 PET Scan Interpretation

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the performance of physician readers trained to read flortaucipir-PET (positron emission tomography) scans.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Physician PET scan readers are participants, blinded to demographic and clinical data from the source PET scans.
study_design_info.masking_description: PET scans were obtained in an open-label fashion.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET images read as τAD+/τAD++, to detect NFT (neurofibrillary tangles) score of B3.
primary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD and likely to progress (τAD++). Truth standard is autopsy NFT score (Hyman, et al 2012).

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET images read as τAD+/τAD++, to detect high AD neuropathological change.
primary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD and likely to progress (τAD++). Truth standard is NIA-AA autopsy diagnosis (Hyman, et al 2012).

primary_outcome.measure: Inter-reader reliability of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET imaging
primary_outcome.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across all scans read. Scan results binarized as τAD+/τAD++ versus τAD-.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET images read as τAD++, to detect NFT (neurofibrillary tangles) score of B3 (Hyman, et al 2012).
secondary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD and likely to progress (τAD++). Truth standard is autopsy NFT score (Hyman, et al 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET images read as τAD++, to detect high AD neuropathological change (Hyman, et al 2012).
secondary_outcome.description: Flortaucipir F 18 PET imaging will be classified by each reader as either neocortical uptake not consistent with AD (τAD-), neocortical uptake consistent with AD (τAD+), or neocortical uptake consistent with AD and likely to progress (τAD++). Truth standard is NIA-AA autopsy diagnosis (Hyman, et al 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Inter-reader reliability of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET imaging
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across all scans read. Scan results binarized as τAD++ versus τAD+/τAD-.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inter-reader reliability of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET imaging
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Fleiss' Kappa across 60 scans from Study A05. Scan results binarized as τAD+/τAD++ versus τAD-.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra-reader reliability of reader interpretation of Flortaucipir-PET imaging
secondary_outcome.description: Twenty scans will be randomly selected from the 143 cases included for this study, and the 5 readers will read them in random sequence along with other scans. Cohen's Kappa will be calculated for each of these 5 readers, based on these 20 scans read twice to assess the intra-reader reliability of flortaucipir F 18 PET scan visual interpretation.

arm_group.description: No study drug will be administered. Scans previously acquired from Study A16 (NCT02516046) and A05 (NCT02016560) will be read by independent, blinded readers.

intervention.description: No study drug will be administered. Scans previously acquired from Study A16 (NCT02516046) and A05 (NCT02016560) will be read by independent, blinded readers.

criteria.textblock:
Scan Reader Criteria (5 total):
- Board-certified in radiology or nuclear medicine
- Professional experience interpreting PET scans
- Naive to study protocol
- No previous training or exposure to Avid Flortaucipir F 18 read methodology
Scan Criteria:
- Previous enrollment in Study A05 confirmatory cohort (NCT02016560), or A16 (NCT02516046)
Scan Study Population Criteria for FR01 (A05 confirmatory cohort):
- Cognitively-impaired
- MCI or dementia with suspected neurodegenerative cause
- MMSE score of 20-27, inclusive
Scan Study Population Criteria for FR01 (Study A16):
- Subjects at end of life (less than or equal to 6 months)
- Imaged with flortaucipir F18 and came to autopsy
